Nothing like one of those days where you are able to come home early from lab, and able to work on some educational chemistry graphics when the mid day sun is still coming in #science #chemistry #academictwitter #notetaking0:09
40 views

Enjoyed the refresher on the importance of notetaking and Cornell notes in my reading this week. Due to hybrid learning, some of my lecturing is happening at home via video. Important we take the time to teach students how to take notes/learn in a year where nothing seems normal.
im kinda thinking of getting an ipad because i wanna switch to digital notetaking.... esp because im at home and printer ink is so expensive.. hmmm

I’m following this “cambrian explosion “ of notetaking/knowledge base/zettelkasten apps, examples include Roam research, notion, obsidian. I’ve been trying a few, but I always return to my home backed shellscript

Listen to me. If you have teachers who don't pass out lecture notes or share their slides for you to revise at home, learn notetaking shorthand and use your pen and paper. Let your hands help your brain commit things to memory.Quote Tweet

I post my master digital notebook on my google site, so if a student is away they can see what we did and get caught up. Students who find the notetaking hard can finish up what they missed at home, and some get a head start at home the night before.

Just set up openssh-server on my home machine so that I can edit my folder of markdown files using vim from my iPad.

I may be overthinking this notetaking thing

Unsure of the source of this image but watching the following shows or reading can be part of your home learning. Why not use this as a chance to practise notetaking! Set yourself some aims before you watch/read and take some notes.

I am currently working from home and available for Remote Captioning, Electronic Notetaking and Lipspeaking services (with or without SSE). 

No specialist equipment is needed to receive captions - 
Skype/Zoom/landline for audio and Wi-Fi enabled device to receive captions.

Maybe you’ve encouraged your students before to “take good notes". It's imperative now with a lot of students across the U.S. working from home that they take good notes. Here are a few tips to help your students improve their notetaking skills: http://bit.ly/3c9Zn1l

@magsbainesWe didn't have students in on Thurs/Fri and I was at home on Wed (asthma) so I'm nicely ahead. For now, 'lessons' consist of students reading/notetaking from their textbooks and answering some questions, and some helpful YouTube videos I've found for them.

#RoamResearch is a #notetaking app designed to be the home of all your thoughts and outputs. It’s been launched 4 months ago, and I am obsessed with it. The real innovation and unique thing about roam is the feature called Notes [[]] (Bidirectional Links)Roam Research Product Review
